messages.subject: history/was whatever article
messages.msgSnippet: -=-I didn t pay much attention to the history of it because I went to school and I never learned about all that LOL-=- Not paying attention to history in
messages.messageBody:
-=-I didn't pay much attention to the history of it because I went to
school and I never learned about all that LOL-=-

Not paying attention to history in school shouldn't be an excuse to last the
rest of one's life. He was talking about the history of homeschooling and
public schools, neither of which is taught in school. It surprises me that some
people really don't know or care about the history of homeschooling, but I do
care, and I learned it as I've gone, in homeschooling, and I've never trusted
the word of one single source but read things myself and waited to see if it
seemed true.

If there are people who really don't care about what's real or not about
history, to whose advantage is it to say "Oh, I didn't see a problem"? If people
are printing this out for others to read or putting it on webpages, I DO see a
problem because it's slanted and based on fallacy.

Sandra
